stimulusHtml: Let h be the depth, in feet, of oil in the tank. How fast was the depth of oil in the tank increasing when h = 4 ? Indicate all units of measure.

features.html:
An oil storage tank has the shape as shown above, obtained by revolving the curve  y = 9 625 x 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyEaiabg2 da9maalaaabaGaaGyoaaqaaiaaiAdacaaIYaGaaGynaaaacaWG4bWa aWbaaSqabeaacaaI0aaaaaaa@3CF0@ from x = 0 to x = 5 about the y-axis, where x and y are measured in feet.

Oil weighing 50 pounds per cubic foot flowed into an initially empty tank at a constant rate of 8 cubic feet per minute. When the depth of oil reached 6 feet, the flow stopped.
